pr_title: Issue 4673: Bump up versions of some of the dependencies

timeline.message:
Bump up dependency versions

Signed-off-by: Ravi Sharda <ravi.sharda@emc.com>

Bump up Hadoop version to one using a later version of Guava

Signed-off-by: Ravi Sharda <ravi.sharda@emc.com>

Make upgraded Hadoop work, and upgrade other libs.

Signed-off-by: Ravi Sharda <ravi.sharda@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText:
This is not acceptable. We should never downgrade dependencies because we could be reintroducing bugs that were solved by upgrading in the first place.
Please find another solution to this problem.
timeline.author: andreipaduroiu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -31,10 +31,14 @@ gradleLombokPluginVersion=3.2.0
 gradleMkdocsPluginVersion=1.0.0
 gradleSshPluginVersion=2.9.0
 grpcVersion=1.17.1
-guavaVersion=28.1-jre
-hadoopVersion=2.8.5
+
+# Downgraded the Guava version, to avoid version conflicts with transitiv dependencies of HDFS. Guava versions above
+# this one do not have `com.google.common.util.concurrent.Futures` `addCallback(ListenableFuture, FutureCallback)`
+# method, which is in turn used by HDFS server class `org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.checker.ThrottledAsyncChecker`.
+guavaVersion=25.1-jre

replies.bodyText: Yes, that makes sense. I've reverted the change.
replies.author: ravisharda
